byline.contributor: Liz Alderman contributed reporting from Paris.

abstract: European Commission president Jose Manuel Barroso calls for European banks to temporarily increase their capital buffers to better withstand the sovereign debt crisis; proposes that European Union members maximize capacity of their 440 billion euro ($600 billion) bailout fund, indication he favors leveraging the fund.
snippet: The president of the European Commission said on Wednesday that banks should temporarily increase their capital buffers to better withstand the crisis.
lead_paragraph: The president of the European Commission said on Wednesday that banks should temporarily increase their capital buffers to better withstand the crisis.

headline.main: Europe Tells Its Banks to Raise New Capital
headline.print_headline: Europe Tells Its Banks To Raise New Capital
